...that we need here? That difference is because the Jones Act prevents any real competition on Hawaii’s shipping lifeline from the mainland and we can’t access far lower international shipping rates. Here’s my release and remarks to the full US House: https://case.house.gov/media/press-releases/case-introduces-bills-attack-key-driver-hawaii-s-high-cost-living …

I just introduced three bills to take on the hundred year old Jones Act, a key and unfair cause of Hawaii’s high cost of living. Ever wonder why a gallon of milk costs $6.39 in Hawai‘i but only $4.49 from where it’s shipped? Or any other product from the mainland...

The bill will eliminate the $10,000 state and local tax deduction cap implemented in the unfair 2017 tax law, allowing most Hawai’i taxpayers to pay less federal tax dollars as an offset against our high state and local taxes.
I voted today for the Restoring Tax Fairness for States and Localities Act today to help Hawai‘i taxpayers. pic.twitter.com/clHxCgWoUi

Here are my remarks to the full House on introduction:  https://bit.ly/2PDS0WB 
 https://cs.pn/38X0M9R

My bill follows leading countries elsewhere and applies the same inspection standards for goods leaving Hawai‘i for the mainland to goods coming into our state. Hawai‘i unique and endangered environment deserves the same protections as those given to the rest of the country.

Today I introduced my Hawai‘i Invasive Species Protection Act to tackle the accelerating crisis of invasive species destroying our natural resources and crippling much of our agriculture. pic.twitter.com/3unfl2czFJ
and adding needed protections for workers and the environment. #USMCA will add thousands of new jobs nationwide and expand Hawaii's $20 million of annual exports to Canada and Mexico.

I voted today to update our key trade agreement with our leading trade partners, Canada and Mexico, after the US House substantially improved the agreement initially proposed by the President by rejecting giveaways to big business

The bill will eliminate the $10,000 state and local tax deduction cap implemented in the unfair 2017 tax law, allowing most Hawai’i taxpayers to pay less federal tax dollars as an offset against our high state and local taxes.
